questions.question: He can put ............................ gallons of Coke.
questions.description: To put away is to consume food or drink in large quantities.

questions.question: Criminals who pose a threat to the society should be put ............................
questions.description: To put somebody away is to confine them in a prison.

questions.question: I donâ€™t like it when you put me ........................... in front of my colleagues.
questions.description: To put somebody down is to criticize them.

questions.question: The police failed to put ............................. the riots.
questions.description: To put down a riot is to end it by force.

questions.question: Since the dog had hardly any chances of recovery, we had to put him .............................
questions.description: To put down an animal is to kill it.

questions.question: Her rude behavior put me ...........................
questions.description: To put somebody off is to cause them to feel dislike.

questions.question: The exam has been put ...............................
questions.description: To put off an exam is to postpone it.

questions.question: His insistence that I should lend him some money put me ............................
questions.description: To put somebody out is to cause them inconvenience.

questions.question: My cousin has agreed to put me ............................. when I visit Mumbai next week.
questions.description: To put somebody up is to accommodate them.

questions.question: I cannot put .................................. his impertinence.
questions.description: To put up with something is to tolerate it.

questions.question: Dad is trying to put ........................... a fence around the garden.
questions.description: To put up a fence is to erect it.

questions.question: If banks put ............................ their interest rates, it will hurt the interests of the economy.
questions.description: To put something up is to increase its value.
